verses.text: 耶穌為門徒洗腳逾越節以前，耶穌知道自己離開這世界回到父那裡去的時候到了。他既然愛世上屬於自己的人，就愛他們到底。

words.note: Lit. 'door follower', often referring to students or apprentices.
A common custom of hospitality in ancient times.
Refers to God the Father.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Figuratively means 'to the very end' or 'through and through'.

verses.text: 吃晚飯的時候，
耶穌知道父已經把萬有交在他手中，並且知道自己從 神而來，又要回到 神那裡去，

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
A formal term for 'everything' often used in religious texts.
Figuratively means 'under his control'.
The empty space before 神 is a reverence mark.
Often used in formal or literary contexts to denote origin.
The empty space before 神 is a reverence mark.

verses.text: 就起身離席，脫去外衣，拿一條手巾束腰。

words.note: Refers to leaving one's place at a banquet or gathering.
An action of preparation for service or labor.

verses.text: 然後他倒了一盆水，洗門徒的腳，並且用束腰的手巾擦乾。

words.note: Indicates completion or actualization.

verses.text: 輪到西門．彼得，彼得就說：「主啊，你要洗我的腳嗎？」

words.note: A title of reverence for God or Jesus.
Expresses surprise, admiration, or a pause.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「我所作的，你現在不知道，以後就會明白。」

words.note: Indicates the following verb is the object of an implied noun.
Forms a noun phrase 'that which is done' with 所作.

verses.text: 彼得說：「不行，你千萬不可洗我的腳！」耶穌說：「如果我不洗你的腳，你就與我沒有關係了。」

words.note: Used for strong admonitions, 'absolutely must not'.
Often used with 不 to mean 'must not'.

verses.text: 西門．彼得說：「主啊，那就不單洗我的腳，連我的手和頭都洗吧！」

words.note: A title of reverence for God or Jesus.
Expresses surprise, admiration, or a pause.
Indicates a suggestion or mild command.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「洗過澡的人，全身都潔淨，只需要洗腳就可以了。你們是潔淨的，但不是人人都是這樣。」

words.note: A verb-object compound functioning as a single verb.
Indicates a past experience.
Forms a modifying clause 'who has bathed'.
A verb-object compound functioning as a single verb.
Indicates a new situation or completion.
Indicates a quality or characteristic.

verses.text: 原來耶穌知道誰要出賣他，所以他說「你們不是人人都是潔淨的」。

words.note: Implies a revelation or discovery of a fact.
Indicates future action or intention.
Literally 'sell out'.
Reduplication emphasizes 'every single person'.
Often used in a ritual or moral sense in the Bible.
Turns the adjective 'clean' into a noun phrase 'the clean ones'.

verses.text: 耶穌洗完了門徒的腳，就穿上外衣，再坐下來，對他們說：「我給你們作的，你們明白嗎？

words.note: Compound verb indicating completion of the action.
Indicates a completed action or change of state.
Literally 'gate student' or 'follower'.
Indicates a consequence or immediate succession.
Indicates another action following a previous one.
Directional complement indicating movement downwards towards the speaker.
Here acting as a preposition meaning 'for' or 'to'.
Turns the verb phrase '我給你們作' into a noun phrase 'what I have done for you'.

verses.text: 你們稱呼我『老師，主』，你們說得對，我本來就是。

words.note: A respectful title for God or a superior.
Resultative compound indicating the result of saying is being correct.
Indicates something is inherently or naturally so.
Emphasizes the certainty or immediate relevance.

verses.text: 我是主，是老師，尚且洗你們的腳，你們也應當彼此洗腳。

words.note: Literary/biblical term emphasizing an unexpected or extreme case.
Indicates obligation or appropriateness.
Verb-object compound acting as a single verb, often with spiritual significance.

verses.text: 我作了你們的榜樣，是要你們也照著我所作的去行。

words.note: Can refer to a positive role model.
Indicates desire or intention.
Indicates acting in accordance with something.
Classic literary particle, often used to nominalize a verb or verb phrase.
Turns the phrase '我所作' into a noun phrase 'what I have done'.
Indicates purpose or direction of action.

verses.text: 我實實在在告訴你們，僕人不能大過主人，奉差遣的也不能大過差他的人。

words.note: A reduplicated form emphasizing truth or certainty.
Implies accepting a command or being sent by a superior.
Here '奉差遣的' means 'the one who is sent'.
Here '差他的' means 'the one who sent him'.

verses.text: 你們既然知道這些事，如果去實行，就有福了。

words.note: Literally 'have blessing'.

verses.text: 我這話不是指著你們全體說的；我認識我所揀選的人，但是經上的話：『那吃我飯的，用他的腳踢我』，必須應驗。

words.definition: particle, used for emphasis or forming noun phrases

words.note: Indicates a passive or general action. '所揀選的' means 'those who are chosen'.
Refers specifically to written scripture.
'那...的' means 'the one who...'.
Often used in the context of prophecy fulfillment.

verses.text: 現在，事情還沒有發生，我就告訴你們，使你們到時可以信我就是『那一位』。

words.note: A respectful title for a significant person, often referring to the Messiah.

verses.text: 我實實在在告訴你們，那接待我所差遣的，就是接待我；接待我的，就是接待那差我來的。」

words.note: '我所差遣的' means 'the one whom I sent'.
'接待我的' means 'the one who receives me'.
'那差我來的' means 'the one who sent me'.

verses.text: 耶穌預言要被人出賣耶穌說了這話，心裡很難過，就明明地說：「我實實在在告訴你們，你們中間有一個人要出賣我。」

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts.
A reduplicated idiom, often translated 'Verily, verily' in King James Version.

verses.text: 門徒彼此相看，不知道他是指著誰說的。

words.note: Lit. 'door follower' or 'student (at a school's door)'.

verses.text: 門徒中有一個人，是耶穌所愛的，側身挨近耶穌（「側身挨近耶穌」原文作「在耶穌的胸懷裡」）。

words.note: Used before a verb to form a nominalized passive phrase, e.g., 'that which is loved'.

verses.text: 西門．彼得向他示意，叫他問耶穌是指著誰說的。
於是那個門徒貼近耶穌的胸懷，問他：「主啊，是誰呢？」

words.note: A respectful title for God or Jesus.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「我蘸一小塊餅給誰，誰就是了。」於是他蘸了一小塊餅，遞給加略人西門的兒子猶大。

words.note: Refers to a person from Kerioth.

verses.text: 猶大接過餅以後，撒但就進入他的心。耶穌對他說：「你要作的，快去作吧。」
在座的人，沒有一個知道耶穌為甚麼對猶大說這話。
猶大是管錢的，所以有人以為耶穌叫他去買過節用的東西，或是吩咐他拿點東西去賙濟窮人。
猶大吃了餅，立刻就出去；那時是黑夜了。
吩咐門徒要彼此相愛他出去以後，耶穌就說：「現在人子得了榮耀， 神也在人子身上得了榮耀，

words.note: A title used by Jesus for himself.
A title used by Jesus for himself.

verses.text: （ 神既然在人子身上得了榮耀，）也要在自己身上榮耀人子，並且要立刻榮耀他。

words.note: A title used by Jesus for himself.

verses.text: 孩子們啊，我跟你們在一起的時候不多了。你們要尋找我，但是我對猶太人說過，現在也照樣對你們說：『我去的地方，是你們不能去的。』
我給你們一條新命令，就是要你們彼此相愛；我怎樣愛你們，你們也要怎樣彼此相愛。

words.note: Classifier for long, thin, or abstract things like commands.

verses.text: 如果你們彼此相愛，眾人就會認出你們是我的門徒了。」
預言彼得不認主西門．彼得對耶穌說：「主啊，你往哪裡去？」耶穌回答：「我去的地方，你現在不能跟著我去，但後來卻要跟著我去。」

words.note: Combination of 'Lord' and an interjection particle '啊'

verses.text: 彼得說：「主啊，為甚麼我現在不能跟著你去？為了你，我捨命也願意！」

words.note: Combination of 'Lord' and an interjection particle '啊'

verses.text: 耶穌說：「你願意為我捨命嗎？我實實在在告訴你，雞叫之前，你必定三次不認我。」

words.note: A common biblical phrasing, similar to 'Verily, verily, I say unto you.'
